newsitem.title: GUATEMALA: Guatemala November consumer prices rose 1.13 pct.
newsitem.headline: Guatemala November consumer prices rose 1.13 pct.

text.p: Guatemalan consumer prices rose 1.13 percent in November, compared to a rise of 1.31 percent in the same month last year, the National Statistic Institute said on Thursday.
October inflation this year was 0.38 percent.
Accumulated inflation was 9.90 percent at the end of November compared with 8.08 percent a year ago, the institute said.
Year-on-year inflation in the 12 months to November was 10.44 percent, down from 10.64 percent in the 12 months to October 31. Year-on-year inflation at the end of November 1995 was 8.57 percent.
